Context:
Program Name: Art and Design Foundation
Code: G108
Credential: Ontario College Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 1 year (2 semesters)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $4,256.00 *
International Tuition: $18,293.00 **
Centre: Arts, Design & Information Technology
School: Design
Location: Waterfront Campus
Program Description: A one-year certificate program providing a broad base of expert knowledge and technical skills in art and design. Students will develop their portfolio and explore various art and design disciplines.
Semester 1: Introduction to art and design, history of art, observational drawing, form and space, photography, digital design.
Semester 2: Advanced skills, creative problem-solving techniques, design process, colour theory and practice.
Optional courses for gaining specific skills for future education are available.
*Domestic tuition may be subject to change.
**International tuition may vary based on exchange rates and student visa requirements.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Art and Design Foundation Program G108 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The text is about a Graphic Design or Interaction Design program offered at George Brown. The following are factual information and entities extracted from the text:

- The program offers optional courses to gain specific skills.
- Students can consult with the academic co-ordinator about course selection and future educational pathways.
- Graduates with a minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.5 are eligible for direct entry into the Graphic Design or Interaction Design program.
- Required courses for Semester 1 include ART1019, ART1020, ART1029, INTRODUCTION TO DIGITAL MEDIA, ART1030, ART CULTURE, COMM 2000, and several others.
- Required courses for Semester 2 include ART1021, ART1020, ART1036, ART1024 or ART1019 or ART1040, ART1025, ART1035, ART1035, ART1029, ART1043, DESN1020, and DESN1084.
- Some courses involve life drawing or have prerequisites.
- The program focuses on creating two- and three-dimensional designs using various materials, processes, and techniques.
- Students will learn the design process to develop and solve visual problems using various strategies for idea generation.
- Students will apply the formal elements and principles of design.
- Students will utilize a variety of presentation skills across different media.
- Students will develop skills in portfolio presentation through studio-based projects.
- Students will articulate art concepts, history, and the role of art in society to the general public.
- Students will manage their personal digital presence/brand by participating in professional communities of practice.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Art and Design Foundation Program G108 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
* Tuition and fees for Art & Design Foundation program starting in Fall 2023: Domestic - $4,256.00, International - $18,293.00
* Additional costs (estimated) for Art & Design Foundation program starting in Fall 2023: Not included in the text
* Tuition and fees for Art & Design Foundation program starting in Fall 2024: Domestic - To be determined, International - $18,293.00 (same as Fall 2023 international tuition)
* Financial assistance for Art & Design Foundation program: OSAP funding is available for applicants who meet eligibility criteria
* Admission requirements for Art & Design Foundation program: Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, grade 12 English (C or U), recommendation for at least one high school-level art class and some experience in photography, illustration and digital image creation. Mature students may take the Admissions Assessment for English or upgrade to achieve required English credit(s).
* Course exemptions: College or university credits may qualify

Context: "The program is part of the School of Design, located at the Waterfront Campus, 3 Lower Jarvis St., Toronto, Ontario, Canada. For more information about the program or to contact the program coordinator, Bahar Mousavi Hejazi (bmousavi@georgebrown.ca), please visit the contact page. Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System. The School of Design building supports academic programs and industry projects with features such as a virtual and augmented reality lab, usability and testing lab, future Ways of Living lab, peer tutor lab, digital sandbox, incubators, prototyping and workshop spaces, design and innovation showcase spaces. Information sessions and campus tours are available for prospective students."
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Art and Design Foundation Program G108 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context: To book a campus tour or info session, visitors are required to provide their first name, last name, email address, and indicate whether they are domestic or international students. They must also agree to receive email communications from George Brown College.
